name: 1,3-Butadiene

energies.comment: Conjugated system (alternating double bonds) but acyclic. ~15-20 kJ/mol conjugation stabilization. MUCH less than benzene's 150 kJ/mol. Naive: 2×602 + 346 + 6×413 = 4028 kJ/mol. Actual (with conjugation): ~4045 kJ/mol (+17 kJ/mol). Tests: does conjugation require cycles for strong stabilization?

notes: Alternating double bonds allow π-electron delocalization
Central C-C bond has partial double-bond character (~1.46 Å)
Conjugation stabilization ~15-20 kJ/mol (10× less than benzene!)
Critical test: is the cycle necessary for strong stabilization?
Hypothesis: cycles create stronger correlation than linear conjugation
